definition: to accept a life of ease/to enjoy a comfortable retirement
surname Na
to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: Hanging a gourd on the wall next to your front door is thought to bring wealth and fortune.
sentences.chinese: 在大門口旁可以掛上一個葫蘆，一般認爲可招財納福。

sentences.english: Enjoy the best Solitaire mobile with this pack of 16 variants of the famous card game.
sentences.chinese: 納福最好的紙牌移動這個包16變種著名的紙牌遊戲。

definition: auspicious/propitious/good fortune
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
the country prospers, the people at peace (idiom); peace and prosperity
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
May you have peace year after year (New Year's greeting)
lit. (may you) have abundance year after year/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
to offer birthday congratulations (to an elderly person)
may you enjoy boundless longevity (idiom)/long may you live
to drive out devils/exorcism
to start practicing at the first crow of the cock (idiom)/to be diligent in one's studies
profits pouring in from all sides (idiom)/raking in money/bonanza
to arrive home/facing one's home/home-coming/(soccer) facing the goalmouth
to have all one's wishes (idiom)/best wishes/all the best/may all your hopes be fulfilled
lit. (may the) five blessings descend upon this home (namely: longevity, wealth, health, virtue, and a natural death)/(an auspicious saying for the Lunar New Year)
(in the spring) nature takes on a new look (idiom)
to drive out devils/to exorcise
